strings.Value: "You know what? Let's get married. Will you be my king?"
"If we have a future — it's one it's one we share together."
"You've done a lot for me too. I have no idea how I would live without you."
"I was very scared for you. Especially because you kept silence about your feelings."
{n}Tonight Regongar was especially passionate. He screamed in your arms, and when it was over, he lay still for a long time, staring at the ceiling and biting his lips.{/n}

"You know... There was this chump in {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} who went mad because of all the torture. He thought there was no one in the world but him. He said that when he closed his eyes, I disappeared. That's just about how I've felt during the last few months. Like if you're not looking at me, I don't exist. Like a ghost that's only real when you touch me. I cut my skin to make sure I still have red blood."

"No one needs me. Especially myself. I'm not even alone, I'm simply nobody. But you... {Name}, my {Name}... You've kept me alive. If you let me go for even a moment, I'll probably fall right through the ground into {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}'s palm. It's only thanks to you that I can even make myself move... And now I've started to feel alive again. For the first time I feel like I have some sort of future."
"Who, me? A king? Look at me, ha ha! I'm not husband material, let alone a king."

"Yes. Now there's only one thing left to do — face the powers of this world and another, and tear them all to pieces. People, monsters, fey, gods — doesn't matter. Everyone who wants to take away our future. And then..."

"Wait, are you serious? You really want to marry me?" {n}Regongar looks baffled for a moment, then smiles a broad smile quickly.{/n} "All right. Let's do it, of course. It's just... Let's postpone the wedding until the victory, all right? When we don't have swords hanging over our heads. I want it to feel like we really do have a future."
{n}The half-orc smiles.{/n} "Then it will be just you and me."
"So we really met for a reason. The gods aren't good for much, of course, but sometimes they send gifts... Like you and me to each other."

"Yes... I should have told you everything earlier instead of letting it gnaw me up. But I didn't quite understand myself. And then... I was such an idiot — I was afraid to tell you, afraid you'd laugh and push me away. I'm so sorry."
